abstracts.cdata!:
The Fifth Development Policy Loan
            (DPL-5) Project is the fifth in a series of policy loans to
            Indonesia, but the first proposed under the FY09-FY12
            Country Partnership Strategy (CPS) that was approved by the
            Board in September, 2008. The 4 earlier DPLs from 2004 to
            2007 constituted a program of annual, single tranche loans
            anchored to the previous Country Assistance Strategy (CAS).
            The overall goal of the DPL-5 program is to help the
            Government of Indonesia (GoI) achieve its medium-term growth
            and poverty reduction objectives. The DPL-5 supports the
            GoI's reform efforts in the following objectives: (i)
            improve the investment climate; (ii) enhance public
            financial management and governance; and (iii) improve
            service delivery to the poor. The investment pillar is
            aligned to the CPS objective of enhancing the environment
            for private sector development to foster accelerated growth
            and poverty reduction and strengthen competitiveness and
            inclusiveness. The public financial management triggers are
            also designed to support another key policy area of the CPS
            on strengthening central government institutions and systems
            through increasing accountability and transparency in
            government financial management and to enhance public
            financial management and governance to increase the
            development impact of priority budget expenditures. Finally,
            improving the institutional capacity to better target
            poverty alleviation programs is a critical step to achieving
            the CPS objective of more efficient delivery of public
            services to reduce poverty levels and improve equity.
